info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 8:49PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Pondera and northwestern Teton Counties through 915 PM MDT... At 848 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles south of Heart Butte, or 35 miles northwest of Choteau, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Pondera and northwestern Teton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
